section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: This section introduces the fundamental concepts of variables and data types in Python programming. Students will learn how to create and manipulate variables, work with different data types including numbers, strings, and booleans, and perform type conversions. Through hands-on exercises, students will gain practical experience in using Python's built-in data types effectively.
learning_objectives: Create and assign variables using proper Python naming conventions
Differentiate between and use numeric data types (integers and floats)
Manipulate strings using Python's built-in methods
Apply boolean logic to evaluate conditions
Convert between different data types using type casting functions

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to declare variables, assign values, and follow Python naming conventions
key_topics: Variable assignment using the equals operator

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create 5 variables with different data types: name (string), age (integer), height (float), is_student (boolean), and gpa (float). Use meaningful variable names following Python conventions. Print each variable to verify its value and type.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to use integers and floats to perform mathematical operations

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write a program that calculates the area of a rectangle, circle, and triangle. Use appropriate data types for dimensions and results. For the circle, use pi = 3.14159. Print all results with descriptive labels, formatted to 2 decimal places.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to use Python string methods to process and format text
key_topics: Common string methods (upper, lower, strip, split)

exercises.exercise_instructions: Given the string '  Python Programming is FUN!  ', perform the following operations: remove leading/trailing spaces, convert to uppercase, split into words, replace 'FUN' with 'exciting', and count the number of characters. Print each result with a description.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to create and evaluate boolean expressions using comparison and logical operators

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create variables for age, has_license, and has_car. Write boolean expressions to check if: person can drive (age >= 16 and has_license), person can drive alone (all three conditions), and person cannot drive (any condition fails). Print the results with clear descriptions.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to convert between data types and check variable types programmatically
key_topics: Using int(), float(), str(), bool() functions
Type checking with type() and isinstance()

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create variables: num_str = '123', float_str = '45.67', bool_val = True, and negative_int = -42. Convert each to all other types where possible. For each conversion, print the original value, its type, the converted value, and the new type. Handle any conversion errors gracefully.
